Different Crime.Crime Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

reasonableness_standard: Credibility findings are reviewed under the reasonableness standard.
relationship_genuineness: Refugee claimants must demonstrate a well-founded fear of persecution without being required to conceal immutable characteristics.
expert_testimony: The Board member found inconsistencies in Okoli's testimony, rejected his explanations, and concluded he lacked credibility.
internal_flight_alternative: The IFA finding relied on discretion about sexual orientation, which contradicts case law prohibiting repression of immutable traits.
appeal_outcome: The court granted judicial review, remitting the case for re-evaluation by a different board due to unreasonable credibility and IFA findings.
cause_of_action: Okoli claimed refugee status due to persecution as a homosexual in Nigeria but was denied based on credibility issues and an available internal flight alternative.
procedural_fairness: Judicial review application challenging the Refugee Protection Division's decision, arguing the Board ignored or misapprehended evidence.
visa officers have statutory powers to assess applications but cannot reconsider decisions unless explicitly allowed
judicial_authority: court found it to be a new decision due to reconsideration of facts
appeal_outcome: applicant may seek an extension to challenge the original January 10, 1994 decision
